overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits, which is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system. [1] The pilot program shall implement trauma-informed and evidence-based practices with the goal of diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the legislature annually, and this Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB727) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] [1] These funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided bill does not specify the assumptions or methodology used to calculate financial projections. [1] The bill leaves the appropriation amount blank, and no cost estimation methods or data sources are detailed. [1] The fiscal impact is based on the creation of seven temporary positions and the provision of various services, but the cost for these items is not provided. [1]
agency_impact: There is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [1] This measure requires the establishment of seven temporary positions within the judiciary to support the pilot program. [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature prior to the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1]
economic_impact: The goal of the program is to divert participants from incarceration, support their success in the community, and reduce recidivism. [1] Women offenders face unique barriers to success after incarceration such as lower educational attainment and lack of stable work history. [1] A similar program in the first circuit that began accepting participants in January of 2023 had twenty-three women participating as of August, 2024. [1]
policy_impact: This measure is based on Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] [1]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] [1] The bill does not identify any other sources of revenue to support the program. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025, and shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The bill appropriates an unspecified sum from the general fund for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] [1] These funds are for equipment, services, and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The temporary positions include social worker V, social worker IV, circuit court clerk II, and judicial clerk positions. [1] No appropriation is specified for fiscal year 2027-2028, which is the third and final year of the pilot program. [1] The judiciary is required to submit annual reports to the legislature regarding the status of the pilot program. [1] These reports will include recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should continue, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [1] Because the program is set to be repealed, there are no stated fiscal implications for the fourth, fifth, or sixth years. [1] Any costs beyond June 30, 2028, would be dependent on future legislation. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided legislative documents do not indicate any anticipated impacts on operating revenues as a result of this measure. [1] The pilot program is funded through an appropriation from general revenues. [1] There is no mention of the program generating revenue through fees or other mechanisms. [1]
Full_Time_Equivalent_Positions: The bill provides for the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The positions are: full-time equivalent social worker V positions, full-time equivalent social worker IV positions, full-time equivalent circuit court clerk II positions, and full-time equivalent judicial clerk positions. [1] [1] The bill does not specify the number of FTE for each position classification. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The appropriation for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 includes an unspecified amount for equipment. [1] The bill does not provide a breakdown of costs for these capital expenditures. [1] No other capital expenditures, such as for facilities or infrastructure, are mentioned. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028, which is within the six-year fiscal period. [1] The judiciary is required to submit recommendations as to whether the pilot program should continue, expand, or be discontinued. [1] Any ongoing fiscal obligations after the program's sunset date would be contingent on new legislation being enacted. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison.
